TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class Identity : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.IO.ISerializable, Java.Security.IPrincipal

.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Identity extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.IO.ISerializable, class Java.Security.IPrincipal, class System.IDisposable
type Identity = class inherit Object interface ISerializable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable interface IPrincipal

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This class is obsoleted in this android platform")]
[<System.Obsolete("This class is obsoleted in this android platform")>]

Docs.summary: This class represents identities: real-world objects such as people, companies or organizations whose identities can be authenticated using their public keys.

remarks.para: This class represents identities: real-world objects such as people, companies or organizations whose identities can be authenticated using their public keys. Identities may also be more abstract (or concrete) constructs, such as daemon threads or smart cards.

All Identity objects have a name and a public key. Names are immutable. Identities may also be scoped. That is, if an Identity is specified to have a particular scope, then the name and public key of the Identity are unique within that scope.
An Identity also has a set of certificates (all certifying its own public key). The Principal names specified in these certificates need not be the same, only the key.
An Identity can be subclassed, to include postal and email addresses, telephone numbers, images of faces and logos, and so on.
Added in 1.1.

This member is deprecated. This class is deprecated and subject to removal in a future version of Java SE. It has been replaced by java.security.KeyStore, the java.security.cert package, and java.security.Principal.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

since.version: Added in API level 1Deprecated since API level 1

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddCertificate(class Java.Security.ICertificate certificate) cil managed
abstract member AddCertificate : Java.Security.ICertificate -> unit override this.AddCertificate : Java.Security.ICertificate -> unit

Docs.summary: Adds a certificate for this identity.

remarks.para: Adds a certificate for this identity. If the identity has a public key, the public key in the certificate must be the same, and if the identity does not have a public key, the identity's public key is set to be that specified in the certificate.
First, if there is a security manager, its checkSecurityAccess method is called with "addIdentityCertificate" as its argument to see if it's ok to add a certificate.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the certificate is not valid.

MemberSignature.Value: public override sealed bool Equals (Java.Lang.Object? identity);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(class Java.Lang.Object identity) cil managed

Docs.param: the object to test for equality with this identity.
Docs.summary: Tests for equality between the specified object and this identity.
Docs.returns: true if the objects are considered equal, false otherwise.

remarks.para: Tests for equality between the specified object and this identity. This first tests to see if the entities actually refer to the same object, in which case it returns true. Next, it checks to see if the entities have the same name and the same scope. If they do, the method returns true. Otherwise, it calls #identityEquals(Identity) identityEquals, which subclasses should override.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IdentityEquals(class Java.Security.Identity identity) cil managed
abstract member IdentityEquals : Java.Security.Identity -> bool override this.IdentityEquals : Java.Security.Identity -> bool

Docs.param: the identity to test for equality with this identity.
Docs.summary: Tests for equality between the specified identity and this identity.
Docs.returns: true if the identities are considered equal, false otherwise.

remarks.para: Tests for equality between the specified identity and this identity. This method should be overriden by subclasses to test for equality. The default behavior is to return true if the names and public keys are equal.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string? Info { get; set; }
member this.Info : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns general information previously specified for this identity. -or- Specifies a general information string for this identity.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Returns general information previously specified for this identity.
Property setter documentation:
Specifies a general information string for this identity.
First, if there is a security manager, its checkSecurityAccess method is called with "setIdentityInfo" as its argument to see if it's ok to specify the information string.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Java.Security.IPublicKey? PublicKey { get; set; }
member this.PublicKey : Java.Security.IPublicKey with get, set

Docs.param: the public key for this identity.
Docs.summary: Returns this identity's public key. -or- Sets this identity's public key.
Docs.value: the public key for this identity.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Returns this identity's public key.
Property setter documentation:
Sets this identity's public key. The old key and all of this identity's certificates are removed by this operation.
First, if there is a security manager, its checkSecurityAccess method is called with "setIdentityPublicKey" as its argument to see if it's ok to set the public key.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if another Identity in the same scope as this Identity already has the same PublicKey.

abstract member RemoveCertificate : Java.Security.ICertificate -> unit override this.RemoveCertificate : Java.Security.ICertificate -> unit

Docs.summary: Removes a certificate from this identity.

remarks.para: Removes a certificate from this identity.
First, if there is a security manager, its checkSecurityAccess method is called with "removeIdentityCertificate" as its argument to see if it's ok to remove a certificate.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the certificate is not found.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string ToString(bool detailed) cil managed

Docs.param: whether or not to provide detailed information.
Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of this identity, with optionally more details than that provided by the toString method without any arguments.
Docs.returns: information about this identity. If detailed is true, then this method returns more information than that provided by the toString method without any arguments.

remarks.para: Returns a string representation of this identity, with optionally more details than that provided by the toString method without any arguments.
First, if there is a security manager, its checkSecurityAccess method is called with "printIdentity" as its argument to see if it's ok to return the string.
